member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFClippingRegion
member.summary:
Defines a clipping region on the page.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: A clipping region defines an area on the page that limits the visible content to that inside the area. Content outside the area is not visible. When a clipping region is in place, the subsequent graphic operations are clipped at the border of the region until the clipping region is reset to whole page.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFClippingRegion.ClipGraphic
member.summary:
Gets the clipping graphic object that defines this region.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A descendant specifying the clipping region.
member.remarks: Only the following shapes can be used as clipping regions: rectangles, pies, polygons and ellipses.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFClippingRegion.ResetCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of Q operators to generate in the content stream.
member.remarks: This flag was introduced for metafiles conversion to allow full reset of transformation matrix.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFClippingRegion.SaveGraphicState
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to save or not the graphic state when the clipping region is set.
member.remarks: This flag was introduced for metafiles conversion. Usually, the graphics in the metafile save and restore the graphic state explicitly.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFEllipse
member.summary:
Defines an ellipse defined by a bounding rectangle specified by a pair of coordinates, a width, and a height.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: When the width of the ellipse equals the height of the ellipse, then a circle is drawn.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode
member.summary: Specifies the available blend modes.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.None
member.summary: Same as Normal, but for internal library use.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Selects the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Multiplies the backdrop and source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of backdrop and source color values, and then complements the result.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors depending on the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors depending on the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors depending on the source color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituents colors from the lighter.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Same as Difference, but lower in contrast.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation and hue of the source color and the luminance of the backdrop color.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminance of the source color and the saturation and hue of the backdrop color.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText
member.summary:
Defines a line of text specified by a printing position and a string.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.Font
member.summary:
Gets or sets the font used to draw the text.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a object used to draw the text.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.Orientation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text orientation.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the rotation angle of the text.
member.remarks: The text is displayed rotated by the angle specified by the property. The value of the property is expressed in degrees and the text is rotated counterclockwise from the x axis. The rotation is done around the printing point, as specified by X and Y properties. The text boxes are always rotated around the top left corner.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.Align
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text alignment
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a enumeration member specifying the alignment of the text relative to the printing point.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.Text
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text to be drawn.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a string value specifying the text to be drawn.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.X
member.summary:
Gets or sets the x coordinate of the printing point
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the x coordinate of the printing point.
member.remarks: The text is aligned on horizontal relative to this value. If the text is left aligned, then this property specifies the x coordinate of the left corner of the text bounding rectangle. If the text is center aligned, then this property specifies the x coordinate of the center of the text bounding rectangle. If the text is right aligned, then this property specifies the x coordinate of the right corner of the text bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.UseGlyphIndexes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text already contains the glyph indexes so no further processing is involved.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFText.Y
member.summary:
Gets or sets the y coordinate of the printing point
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the y coordinate of the printing point.
member.remarks: The text is aligned on vertical relative to this value. If the text is top aligned, then this property specifies the y coordinate of the top corner of the text bounding rectangle. If the text is middle aligned, then this property specifies the y coordinate of the middle of the text bounding rectangle. If the text is bottom aligned, then this property specifies the y coordinate of the bottom corner of the text bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox
member.summary:
Defines a wrapped text specified by its bounding rectangle.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: This class is used to draw columnar text, by confining the text to a specified rectangle.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.FitText(System.String,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFFont,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Calculates how much of the given text fits in the given area.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.param: the text to fit in the given area.
the font used to display the text.
the width of the area.
the height of the area.
the additional space between lines.
the indentation of the first line.
member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment.

the font used to display the text.
the width of the area.
the height of the area.
the additional space between lines.
the indentation of the first line.

member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment.

member.summary:

Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

the font used to display the text.
the width of the area.
the height of the area.
the additional space between lines.
the indentation of the first line.

member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.Left
member.summary:
Gets or sets the x coordinate of the top left corner
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the x coordinate of the top left corner of the text box.
member.exception: Thrown when Left is greater than Right and X axis direction is LeftToRight, or when Left is less than Right and X axis direction is RightToLeft.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.Top
member.summary:
Gets or sets the y coordinate of the top left corner.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the y coordinate of the top left corner of the text box.
member.exception: Thrown when Top is greater than Bottom and Y axis direction is TopToBottom, or when Top is less than Bottom and Y axis direction is BottomToTop.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.Right
member.summary:
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the bottom right corner of the text box.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the x coordinate of the bottom right corner of the text box.
member.exception: Thrown when Right is less than Left and X axis direction is LeftToRight, or when Right is greater than Left and X axis direction is RightToLeft.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.Bottom
member.summary:
Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the bottom right corner of the textbox.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the y coordinate of the bottom right corner of the textbox.
member.exception: Thrown when Bottom is less than Top and Y axis direction is TopToBottom, or when Bottom is greater than Top and Y axis direction is BottomToTop.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.Width
member.summary:
Gets or sets the width of the text box.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the height of the text box.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value representing the height of the text box.
member.exception: Thrown when assigned value is less than 0.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.RequiredHeight
member.summary:
Gets the real height of the wrapped text.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the necessary height of the text box in order to display the whole text.
member.remarks: The calculation of the required height is based on current font and line spacing. If the text box is not attached to the canvas, then its width and height are considered to be points. If the text box is attached to the canvas, then its width and height are considered to be given in canvas' logical units.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.LastLineWidth

Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a boolean value specifying whether the text is clipped by the bounding rectangle or it can flow outside the text box.
member.remarks: This property is obsolete and it is provided only for backwards compatibility. Use instead .

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextBox.LineSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the line spacing.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLText.FontsCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of external fonts used by the HTML formatted text.
member.value: A collection of objects, the key is the name of the font and the object is a font object (TrueTypeFont, PostScriptFont or CJK font object).
member.remarks: All the external fonts used with the HTML formatted text must be added to this collection. The value of "face" attribute of font tag is the key in this collection. The key is case sensitive.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox
member.summary: Defines a wrapped text specified by its bounding rectangle.
member.remarks: This class is used to draw columnar text, by restricting the text to a specified rectangle. The text supports HTML formatting.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.FitText(System.String,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFFont,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Hashtable)
member.summary: Calculates how much of the given text fits in the given area.

the font used to display the text.
the width of the area.
the height of the area.
the additional space between lines.

member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment. The alignment of the text is always considered Top on the vertical.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.FitText(System.String,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFFont,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates how much of the given text fits in the given area.
member.param: the text to fit in the given area.
the font used to display the text.
the width of the area.
the height of the area.
the additional space between lines.
An integer value representing the index within the text where the text to be displayed starts.
member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment. The alignment of the text is always considered Top on the vertical.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.FitText
member.summary: Calculates how much of the text really fits in the box.
member.returns: an integer value representing the length of the text that fits in the area.
member.remarks: The width and height of the area are considered always given in points. The text that fits in the area is always calculated to end with a whole word, not a fragment.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.RequiredHeight
member.summary: Gets the real height of the wrapped text.
member.value: a float value specifying the necessary height of the text box in order to display the whole text.
member.remarks: The calculation of the required height is based on current font and line spacing. If the text box is not attached to the canvas, then its width and height are considered to be points. If the text box is attached to the canvas, then its width and height are considered to be given in canvas' logical units.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.StartDisplayFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the index within the text where the text to be displayed starts.
member.value: An integer value representing the index within the text where the text to be displayed starts.
member.remarks: This value is used when displaying HTML text across multiple text boxes. The HTML text must be split in multiple fragments, one for each text box. Because a separate fragment might not be well formed, it must be considered in the context of the whole text. This index specifies the start position of the fragment within the whole text.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.FontsCollection
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of external fonts used by the HTML formatted text.
member.value: A collection of objects, the key is the name of the font and the object is a font object (TrueTypeFont, PostScriptFont or CJK font object).
member.remarks: All the external fonts used with the HTML formatted text must be added to this collection. The value of "face" attribute of font tag is the key in this collection. The key is case sensitive.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFHTMLTextBox.LastLineWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the last line of text.
member.value: a float value specifying the width of the last line of text in the textbox.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.KeepAspectRatio.KeepBoth
member.summary:

Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the orientation of the image.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value representing the rotation angle of the image.
member.remarks: The orientation of the image is used to draw the image rotated, using the top left corner as rotation center. This value is specified in degrees and the angle is measured counterclockwise from the x axis.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImage.InvertedCMYK
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the CMYK image is inverted(negative) or not.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value representing whether the CMYK image is inverted(negative) or not.
member.remarks: Some graphic design applications save the CMYK images in inverted (negative) mode. One of these applications is Adobe Photoshop. Because there is no way to detect this, this flag if set correctly, allows the library to set up the correct decoding. The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImage.FileName
member.summary:

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImage.ImageRef
member.summary: Gets or sets the reference to original Bitmap image used for drawing, because PDF4NET clones the Bitmap image so the original Bitmap can be disposed before the PDF file is saved. When the image is cloned, the matching can no longer be performed based on Image property.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImage.ImageQuality
member.summary: Gets or sets the image quality.
member.value: A long value specifying the quality for the image.
member.remarks: This property specifies the level of jpeg compression to be applied on the image when it is saved to pdf file. A higher value means higher quality but lower compression, a lower value means low quality by higher compression. The possible values for this property vary from 1 to 100.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFImage.ActiveFrame
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the frame to be drawn on the page.
member.value: An int value specifying the the index of the frame to be drawn on the page.
member.remarks:
This property specifies the frame index within a multiframe image. When a multiframe image is requested to be drawn on the page, this index selects the frame within the image that will be drawn on the page. This property is used by images that include multiple images within the same file, like gif or tiff. The other supported image formats ignore this property.
This index is zero based. If the frame does not exist in the image, then the first frame will be considered for display.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFLogicalUnitBase
member.summary: Base class for all the classes that implement custom logical units.
member.remarks: This class is the base class for implementing user defined logical units. All classes that represent a custom defined logical unit must implement two methods: ToPDFUnitX( float unit ) and ToPDFUnitY( float unit ). These 2 methods need to define the mapping between the logical unit and measure unit used by pdf files, which is the point (1/72 inches). These 2 methods allow to define custom mappings between logical unit and pdf unit (point) for each axis. The mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit shows how many pdf units correspond to a logical unit.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFLogicalUnitBase.ToPDFUnitX(System.Single)
member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the X axis
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the X coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on X axis.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFLogicalUnitBase.ToPDFUnitY(System.Single)
member.summary: Defines the mapping between the logical unit and the pdf unit for the Y axis
member.param: the number of logical units to be converted to pdf units.
member.remarks: This method is used to convert the Y coordinates, which are always expressed in logical units, of a graphic object to pdf units on Y axis.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPointLogicalUnit
member.summary: Defines the point (pdf unit) as a logical unit.
member.remarks: This class defines the point as a logical unit. The mapping between logical unit and pdf unit is one-to-one, one logical unit equals to one pdf unit. The mapping functions simply return the value given as parameter.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFInchLogicalUnit
member.summary: Defines the inch as a logical unit.
member.remarks: This class defines the inch as a logical unit. The mapping between logical unit and pdf unit is 72-to-1, one logical unit equals to 72 pdf units. The mapping functions return the value given as parameter multiplied by 72.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMMLogicalUnit
member.summary: Defines the millimeter as a logical unit.
member.remarks: This class defines the millimeter as a logical unit. The mapping between logical unit and pdf unit is 2.834646-to-1, one logical unit equals to 2.834646 pdf units. The mapping functions return the value given as parameter multiplied by 2.834646.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFCMLogicalUnit
member.summary: Defines the centimeter as a logical unit.
member.remarks: This class defines the centimeter as a logical unit. The mapping between logical unit and pdf unit is 28.34646-to-1, one logical unit equals to 28.34646 pdf units. The mapping functions return the value given as parameter multiplied by 28.34646.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath
member.summary: Represents a series of connected lines and curves.
member.remarks:
A path can be used to create complex geometric shapes that are not available in PDF4NET library as basic drawing primitives.
A path consists of one or more subpaths that can be connected or not. All the points of a subpath are connected through lines and/or curves. A subpath can be open or it can be explicitly closed. When a subpath is explicitly closed, a new subpath is automatically opened and its starting point is (0,0). When the path is filled, its subpaths, that are not explicitly closed, are automatically closed.
Each drawing primitive in a subpath updates the current drawing point. If the current drawing point is explicitly moved using , the current subpath is ended and a new subpath is started.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.MoveTo(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Moves the current point in the path to a new position.
member.param: The x coordinate of the new current point.
The y coordinate of the new current point.
member.remarks: The previous path, if exists, is ended and a new subpath is automatically started.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.LineTo(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Appends a line segment to the end of the current subpath.
member.param: The x coordinate of the line ending point.
The y coordinate of the line ending point.
member.remarks: The new point (x,y) becomes the path current point.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.PolyLineTo(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPoint[])
member.summary: Appends a series of connected line segments to the end of the current subpath.
member.param: An array of objects that represents the points that define the line segments to add.
member.remarks: The last point in the array becomes the new current point in the path.
member.exception: Thrown when points parameter is null.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.Polygon(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPoint[])
member.summary: Add a polygon to this path object.
member.param: An array of objects that represents the points that define the polygon to add.
member.remarks: The polygon defines a closed subpath within the path. The first point in the array is considered as the starting point for the polygon. A new subpath is automatically started and the new current point is the first point of the polygon.
member.exception: Thrown when points parameter is null.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.Rectangle(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add a rectangle to this path object.
member.param: The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.
member.remarks: The rectangle defines a closed subpath within the path. A new subpath is automatically started and the new current point is (left,top).

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.RoundRectangle(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add a rounded rectangle to this path object.
member.param: The x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
The width of the rectangle.
The height of the rectangle.
The width of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
The height of the ellipse used to draw the rounded corners.
member.remarks: The rounded rectangle defines a closed subpath within the path. A new subpath is automatically started and the new current point is (left,top).

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.BezierTo(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Appends a Berzier curve to the end of the current subpath.
member.param: The x coordinate of the first control point.
The y coordinate of the first control point.
The x coordinate of the second control point.
The y coordinate of the second control point.
The x coordinate of the third control point.
The y coordinate of the third control point.
member.remarks: The new point (x3,y3) becomes the path current point.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.PolyBezierTo(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPoint[])
member.summary: Appends a series of connected Bezier curves to the end of the current subpath.
member.param: An array of objects that represents the control points that define the Bezier curves to add.
member.remarks:
Each Bezier curve is defined by 4 points. The first curve uses the current point as its first control point and each following curve uses the last point of the previous curve as its first control point.
The last point in the array becomes the new current point in the path.
member.exception: Thrown when points parameter is null.
Thrown when the last Bezier curve in the array is incomplete.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.Ellipse(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Add an ellipse to this path object.
member.param: The x coordinate of the top left corner of the bounding rectangle.
The y coordinate of the top left corner of the bounding rectangle.
The width of the bounding rectangle.
The height of the bounding rectangle.
member.remarks: The ellipse defines a closed subpath within the path. A new subpath is automatically started and the new current point is (left,top).

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFPath.CloseSubpath
member.summary: Closes the current subpath.
member.remarks: Current subpath is closed. A new subpath is automatically started and the new current point is (0,0).

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.LineSpacing
member.summary:
Gets or sets the line spacing.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the additional space to be added between lines of text.
member.remarks: If this value is negative, then the lines of text will be drawn closer. The value of this property is given in points.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.BreakLongWords
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to break no spaced text at character level.
member.value: A boolean value specifying whether to break no spaced text at character level.
member.remarks: This property allows to perform text wrapping at character level, not only at word level. It applies only if the first word in a line is longer than the available width.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.ClipText
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text clipping mode for the text box
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a enumeration member specifying how the text within the text box should be clipped at box boundary.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.Orientation
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text box orientation.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the rotation angle of the text box.
member.remarks: The text boxes are always rotated around the top left corner.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.Align
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text alignment within the text box.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a enumeration member specifying the alignment of the text within the text box.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.FirstLineIndent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the first line indentation.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the indentation of the first line.
member.remarks:
This value allows the indent the first line of a text box. Also, this value is used to indent the next line when a new line has been requested by the \n character, or
tag in a HTML text box.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFTextFormatOptions.KeepWhiteSpaces
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the white spaces are kept within the text.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a bool value specifying whether the white spaces are kept within the text.
member.remarks:
This property allows to align text using whitespaces (blanks or tabs). It is useful when using a monospaced font like Courier.
This property has effect only on regular text boxes when using left, center or right alignments. Justified text ignores the value of this property.

member.remarks: An image based mask allows to specify a monochrome bitmap that defines what regions of the base image will be painted or not on the page.

member.summary: Defines a base class for all image masks.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFImageMask.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the file representing the mask.
member.value: A string value specifying the name of the file representing the mask.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFImageMask.Stream
member.summary: Gets or sets the stream storing the image mask.
member.value: A object storing the image mask.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFImageMask.Image
member.summary: Gets or sets the image object representing mask.
member.value: A object representing the mask.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFImageMask.ImageData
member.summary: Gets or sets the image data associated with this mask

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFColorImageMask
member.summary: Defines a color-key mask for an image.
member.remarks:
A color-key mask allows to specify a range of colors within an image to be treated as transparent when the image is painted on the page. All the colors between startColor and endColor will be treated as transparent.
A color is considered higher than startColor and lower than endColor when all its components meet this considition individually. For example, in RGB colorspace, being given the color C with its components (Cr, Cg, Cb), then startColor (SC) <= C <= endColor (EC) when:
SCr <= Cr <= ECr AND SCg <= Cg <= ECg AND SCb <= Cb <= ECb.
Note: A color image mask should not be used with jpeg images because they use a lossy image compression and unwanted effects might appear.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFColorImageMask.StartColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the start color for image mask.
member.value: A object specifying the start color for the image mask.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.Transparency.PDFColorImageMask.EndColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the end color for image mask.
member.value: A object specifying the end color for the image mask.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber
member.summary:
Defines the visual aspect of the page number when it is drawn on the page
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: This class works in conjunction with class. In order to have the page number automatically drawn on the page, at least one numberig range must be defined for the document and the page must be included in the interval defined by the numbering range.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.VerticalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical offset used to position the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the vertical offset
member.remarks:
The vertical offset is used when the page number is top or bottom aligned.
When the page number is top aligned, the vertical offset represents the distance between the top margin of the page and the top corner of the rectangle bounding the page number.
When the page number is bottom aligned, the vertical offset represents the distance between the bottom margin of the page and the bottom corner of the rectangle bounding the page number.
When the page number is middle aligned on the vertical, the vertical offset is not used. The vertical middle of the bounding rectangle is positioned at half of page height.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.HorizontalOffset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal offset used to position the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the horizontal offset
member.remarks:
The horizontal offset is used when the page number is left or right aligned.
When the page number is left aligned, the horizontal offset represents the distance between the left margin of the page and the left corner of the rectangle bounding the page number.
When the page number is right aligned, the horizontal offset represents the distance between the right margin of the page and the right corner of the rectangle bounding the page number.
When the page number is center aligned on the horizontal, the horizontal offset is not used. The horizontal center of the bounding rectangle is positioned at half of page width.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.Font
member.summary:
Gets or sets the font used to draw the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a object used to draw the page number

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.Pen
member.summary:
Gets or sets the pen used to draw the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a object used to draw the page number.
member.remarks: This object is used to draw the border of the text representing the page number. If this is null, then the text will be drawn without border. The default value of this property is null.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.Brush
member.summary:
Gets or sets the brush used to draw the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a object used to draw the page number.
member.remarks: This object is used to fill the interior of the text representing the page number. If this is null, then the text will be drawn unfilled. The default value of this property is a brush of black color.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumber.Align
member.summary:
Gets or sets the alignment of text used to draw the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A enumeration member used to position the page number within the page.
member.remarks: This property is used to position the page number within the page. Top and bottom alignments use property to position the page number. Left and right alignments use property to position the page number. Middle and center alignments center the page number on vertical, respectivelly on horizontal.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle
member.summary:
Specifies the available styles when setting up a page numbering range.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle.UpperCaseRoman
member.summary:
The numbering style uses uppercase roman numerals
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle.LowerCaseRoman
member.summary:
The numbering style uses lowercase roman numerals
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle.UpperCaseLetter
member.summary: Upper case letters are used for page numbers.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle.LowerCaseLetter
member.summary: Lower case letters are used for page numbers.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.NumberingStyle.Arabic
member.summary:
The numbering style uses arabic numerals
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange
member.summary:
Defines a series of consecutive pages within the PDF document using the same numbering system
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks:
A numbering range defines a set of consecutive pages that use the same numbering system. The range is considered to start from the page specified by property and ends at the last page of the document. If multiple numbering ranges are defined, then a numbering range ends where the next numbering range starts. The numbering ranges of a document are ordered ascending by property.
For example, a document has an introduction on first 3 pages, then it starts first chapter from the 4th page. A numbering range starting at index zero can be defined for the introduction using roman numerals, then a new numbering range can be defined starting at index 3 using arabic numerals. For this new range, the start page number can be set to 1, this being the first logical page, although it is the 4th physical page in the document.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange.StartPageIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the start page where the numbering range starts.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: an integer value specifying the zero based index of the page where the numbering range starts. The index is considered within the pages collection.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange.StartPageNumber
member.summary:
Gets or sets the page number the numbering of the pages starts for this range.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: an integer value specifying the start page number for this object.
member.remarks: This property specifies the page number that will be printed on the first page in this range. The other pages will be numbered consecutively, starting from this value. It represents a logical page number and it is related to the specific content of the document.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange.PageNumberPrefix
member.summary:
Gets or sets the prefix that will be appended in front of the page number.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a value representing a prefix that is appended to all the page numbers in this range.
member.remarks: This prefix is printed on the pages in the range before the page number. All pages in a range share the same prefix. This prefix is also visible in the Print dialog box of the PDF viewer, when specifing a range of pages to print.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange.PageNumberSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the suffix that will be appended at the end of the page number.
member.value: a value representing a suffix that is appended to all the page numbers in this range.
member.remarks: This prefix is printed on the pages in the range after the page number. All pages in a range share the same suffix.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PageNumberingRange.NumberingStyle
member.summary:
Gets or sets the visual style of the page numbers for this object.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a enumeration member specifying the numbering style for this object.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.XAxisDirection
member.summary: Specifies the available directions for the X axis of the page canvas.
member.remarks: The X axis directions are used when positioning the graphic objects in the page canvas' coordinate system. The RightToLeft direction has no connection with RightToLeft reading and text writting used by some languages.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.XAxisDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: The X axis is oriented from left to right. The values on X axis grow from left to right. This is the default direction used by PDF4NET library.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.XAxisDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: The X axis is oriented from right to left. The values on X axis grow from right to left.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.YAxisDirection
member.summary: Specifies the available directions for the Y axis of the page canvas.
member.remarks: The Y axis directions are used when positioning the graphic objects in the page canvas' coordinate system.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.YAxisDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: The Y axis is oriented from top to bottom. The values on Y axis grow from top to bottom. This is the default direction used by PDF4NET library.

member.name: F:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.YAxisDirection.BottomToTop
member.summary: The Y axis is oriented from bottom to top. The values on Y axis grow from bottom to top.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas
member.summary:
Encapsulates a page's drawing surface.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: This class is mainly used for creating the content of the document. All the drawing functions are exposed by this class. It can not be created directly, it is accessible through the Canvas property of object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawRectangle2(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFPen,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFBrush,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary:
Draws a rectangle specified by a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.param: a object used to draw the border of the rectangle.
a object used to fill the interior of the rectangle.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle.
the width of the rectangle.
the height of the rectangle.
the orientation of the rectangle.
member.remarks:
This function is used to draw a filled rectangle specified by a pair of coordinates, a width and a height. The border of the rectangle is drawn using the object and the rectangle is filled using the object. The rectangle is rotated counterclockwise from the x axis around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter.
This method has been introduced to provide consistency with the whole library, regarding the order of parameters for rectangular objects: left, top, width, height.

member.summary:
Draws an arc representing a portion of an circle specified by a pair of coordinates and a width.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.param: a object used to draw the border of the arc.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the bounding rectangle.

member.remarks:
The height of the bounding rectangle is always equal to the width of the rectangle.
This method has been introduced to provide consistency with the whole library, regarding the order of parameters for rectangular objects: left, top, width, height.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawImage(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.KeepAspectRatio)
member.summary:
Draws an image specified by a file name, a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.param: a full path to the image file.
the x coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the y coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the width of the image.
the height of the image.
the orientation of the image.
a enumeration member specifying how the original aspect ratio of the image should be handled.
member.returns: A float value specifying the calculated image dimension, based on the requested aspect ratio.
member.remarks:
This function is used to draw an image on the canvas. The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically.
Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1.
The following image formats are supported: jpeg, gif, bmp, png, emf.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.DrawImage(System.String,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Draws an image specified by a file name, a pair of coordinates, a width and a height.

the x coordinate of the top left corner of the image.

the quality of the compressed image.
member.returns: A float value specifying the calculated image dimension, based on the requested aspect ratio.
member.remarks:
This function is used to draw an image on the canvas. The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Depending on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically.
Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1.
The following image formats are supported: jpeg, gif, bmp, png, emf.
The ImageQuality parameter specifies the level of jpeg compression to be applied on the image saved to pdf file. A higher value means high quality but low compression, a lower value means low quality but high compression. The values accepted by this parameter vary from 1 to 100. The value of this parameter is ignored when a jpeg image is used.

member.remarks:
This function is used to draw an image on the canvas. The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Depending on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically.
Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1.
The following image formats are supported: jpeg, gif, bmp, png, emf.
The ImageQuality parameter specifies the level of jpeg compression to be applied on the image saved to pdf file. A higher value means high quality but low compression, a lower value means low quality but high compression. The values accepted by this parameter vary from 1 to 100. The value of this parameter is ignored when a jpeg image is used.
The activeFrame parameter specifies the frame index within a multiframe image. When a multiframe image is requested to be drawn on the page, this index selects the frame within the image that will be drawn on the page. This property is used by images that include multiple images within the same file, like gif or tiff. The other supported image formats ignore this property. This index is zero based. the y coordinate of the top left corner of the image.
the width of the image.
the height of the image.
the orientation of the image.
a enumeration member specifying how the original aspect ratio of the image should be handled.
member.returns: A float value specifying the calculated image dimension, based on the requested aspect ratio.
member.remarks:
This function is used to draw an CCITT G4 encoded image on the canvas. It allows to provide directly the CCITT G4 encoded data, so no further encoding is performed by the library.
The top left corner of the image is placed at left,top coordinates. The width and the height of the drawn images are set by the corresponding parameters. The image is rotated around the top left corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter. Depending on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically.
Based on the keepAspectRatio parameter, the width or the height can be computed automatically. If KeepWidth is used, then the height is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated height. If KeepHeight is used, then the width is adjusted to obtain the original image ratio. The return of the function is the calculated width. If KeepNone or KeepBoth are used, then the given width and height parameters are used. The return of the function is -1.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.SetLogicalUnit(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFLogicalUnitBase)
member.summary: Sets the logical unit for the drawing operations.
member.param: a descendant specifying the new logical unit.
member.remarks: The default logical unit used to position graphic objects on the page is given by the LogicalUnit property of the object. During the drawing operations, the logical unit can be changed in order to achieve desired functionality. In this way, some objects can be positioned on the page using one logical unit, while other objects can be positioned using another logical unit.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.SetOrigin(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the new point of origin for the coordinate system.
member.param: The X coordinate of the origin.
The Y coordinate of the origin.
member.remarks: This method moves the origin of the coordinate system to the new position. The new position is always given relative to the current origin. The values specifying the new origin are given in logical units.
member.example:
The following example sets the origin of the coordinate system at 100mm from the left margin of the page and at 100mm from the top margin of the page. The example assumes the current origin is set at the top left corner of the page.
... page.Canvas.SetLogicalUnit( new PDFMMLogicalUnit( ) ); page.Canvas.SetOrigin( 100, 100 ); ...
The direction of the axes is left untouched, from top to bottom and from left to right.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFBasicCanvas.SetAxesDirection(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.XAxisDirection,O2S.Components.PDF4NET.YAxisDirection)
member.summary: Sets the new directions for the axes of the coordinate system.
member.param: A enumeration member specifying the new direction of the X axis.
A enumeration member specifying the new direction of the Y axis.
member.remarks: This method changes the direction of the axes of the coordinate system. The default directions are: top to bottom for the Y axis and left to right for the X axis.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFCanvas
member.summary:
Encapsulates a page's drawing surface.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: This class is mainly used for creating the content of the document. All the drawing functions are exposed by this class. It can not be created directly, it is accessible through the Canvas property of object.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFCanvas.Add(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.PDFGraphic)
member.summary:
Adds a new object to be drawn on page's canvas.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.param: the graphic object to be added to the canvas.
member.remarks: The graphic objects are drawn in the order they were previously added to the canvas. This means that the first added object will be drawn at the bottom, and the last object will be drawn on top of all objects.

The width of the metafile when it is placed on the page.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFCanvas.DrawMetafile(O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Graphics.Shapes.PDFMetafile,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)

The width of the metafile when it is placed on the page.
The height of the metafile when it is placed on the page.
The orientation, in degrees, of the metafile when it is placed on the page.
member.remarks: This function is used to draw a metafile on the canvas. The metafile content is scaled to the rectangle specified by (left, top, width, height) parameters. The metafile is rotated around (left, top) corner with a number of degrees specified by the orientation parameter.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.FlattenFormFields
member.summary: Flattens all the fields in the PDF form, making the PDF file uneditable.
member.remarks: This action is ireversible. Once the form fields have been flattened, they can no longer be edited.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.FlattenFormFields(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flattens all the fields in the PDF form, making the PDF file uneditable.
member.param: True if visible fields should be flattened.
True if hidden fields should be flattened.
True if visible but nonprintable fields should be flattened.
True if hidden but printable fields should be flattened.
member.remarks:
This action is ireversible. Once the form fields have been flattened, they can no longer be edited.
The fields that are not flattened are removed from the document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFDocument.FlattenFormFields(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flattens all the fields in the PDF form, making the PDF file uneditable.
member.param: True if the following flags should be ignored.
True if visible fields should be flattened.
True if hidden fields should be flattened.
True if visible but nonprintable fields should be flattened.
True if hidden but printable fields should be flattened.
member.remarks:
This action is ireversible. Once the form fields have been flattened, they can no longer be edited.
The fields that are not flattened are removed from the document.
IgnoreFlags is used only when all fields are flattened. There are fields with different bits set on /F key (flags) that do not match the definition of FieldVisibilityStatus enumeration so the comparison fails. With this ignore flag all the visibility comparision is ignored and all the fields are flattened.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile
member.summary: Represents a pdf file on disk.
member.remarks: This class defines an existing pdf file. Its methods allows to perform various operations on pdf files. It allows to merge multiple pdf files, split pdf files to individual pages, apply security to existing pdf files, extract full pages or their content from pdf files.

member.summary: Closes the underlying pdf file and frees all resources.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPageContent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the binary content of the specified page.
member.param: the number of the page whose binary content should be retireved.
member.returns: a object representing the binary representation of the page.
member.exception: thrown when pageNumber is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks: This method extracts the binary content of the given page. This content can be later painted on any page canvas. It also can be scaled or rotated and can be painted multiple times. When the binary content of a page is extracted, its width and height are initially equal to the width and height of the original page. Use method to draw the imported content on a new page.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPagesContent(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of imported content objects representing the binary content of the pages given as parameter.
member.param: a set of page numbers, separated by comma or dash, specifying the page numbers whose content should be extracted.
member.returns: an array of objects representing the binary content of the pages given as parameter.
member.exception: thrown when any of the page numbers is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks:
This method extracts the binary content of the given set of pages. This content can be later painted on any page canvas. It also can be scaled or rotated and can be painted multiple times. When the binary content of a page is extracted, its width and height are initially equal to the width and height of the original page. Use method to draw the imported content on a new page.
The page numbers are specified using a comma or dash separated list. Page numbers separated by comma represent single pages, while dash separated page numbers represent page ranges. "1,2,3" represents pages 2, 3 and 4 (remember the page number as parameter is zero based), while "2-5" represents pages 3, 4, 5 and 6. A pages list can contain both comma and dashes, ex: "1, 3, 5-7, 10" meaning that pages 2, 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11 will be extracted.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPagesContent
member.summary: Gets an array of imported content objects representing the binary content of all the pages in the file.
member.returns: an array of objects representing the binary content of all the pages in the file.
member.exception: Thrown when page content can not be extracted due to a PDF parsing error.
member.remarks: This method extracts the binary content of all the pages in the file. This content can be later painted on any page canvas. It also can be scaled or rotated and can be painted multiple times. When the binary content of a page is extracted, its width and height are initially equal to the width and height of the original page. Use method to draw the imported content on a new page.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts the specified page from the current file.
member.param: the number of the page tha will be extracted.
member.returns: a object representing the extracted page.
member.exception: thrown when pageNumber is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks: This method extracts a full page from the current pdf file. This page can be later inserted in any new document keeping all the attributes it had in the old document. Use method to insert the extracted page into a new document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPages(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of imported page objects representing the pages given as parameter.
member.param: a set of page numbers, separated by comma or dash, specifying the pages that should be extracted.
member.returns: an array of objects representing the pages given as paramter.
member.exception: thrown when any of the page numbers is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks:
This method extracts the given set of pages. These pages can be inserted in any new document. Use method to add imported page to current document.
The page numbers are specified using a comma or dash separated list. Page numbers separated by comma represent single pages, while dash separated page numbers represent page ranges. "1,2,3" represents pages 2, 3 and 4 (remember the page number as parameter is zero based), while "2-5" represents pages 3, 4, 5 and 6. A pages list can contain both comma and dashes, ex: "1, 3, 5-7, 10" meaning that pages 2, 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11 will be extracted.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPages
member.summary: Gets an array of imported page objects representing all the pages in the file.
member.returns: an array of objects representing all the pages in the file.
member.exception: Thrown when page content can not be extracted due to a PDF parsing error.
member.remarks: This method extracts all the pages in the file. These pages can be inserted in any new document. Use method to add imported page to current document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPages(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets an array of imported page objects representing the pages in the range specified by startPage and endPage parameters.
member.param: the PDF file from which the pages are extracted.
the zero based index of the first page in the range.
the zero based index of the last page in the range.
member.returns: an array of objects representing the requested range of consecutive pages.
member.exception: thrown when any of the page numbers is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the given pdf file.
member.remarks: This method extracts a consecutive range of pages from the given PDF file. These pages can be inserted in any new document. Use method to add imported page to current document.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPageInfo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts the specified page information from the current file.
member.param: the number of the page whose information will be extracted.
member.returns: a object representing the page information.
member.exception: thrown when pageNumber is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks: This method extracts a only the page information from the current pdf file, no page content is extracted.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.ExtractPagesInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an array of imported page info objects representing the pages given as parameter.
member.param: a set of page numbers, separated by comma or dash, specifying the pages whose information should be extracted.
member.returns: an array of objects representing the pages given as paramter.
member.exception: thrown when any of the page numbers is less than zero or greater than or equal to number of pages in the current pdf file.
member.remarks:
This method extracts the information for the given set of pages without extracting the whole page content.
The page numbers are specified using a comma or dash separated list. Page numbers separated by comma represent single pages, while dash separated page numbers represent page ranges. "1,2,3" represents pages 2, 3 and 4 (remember the page number as parameter is zero based), while "2-5" represents pages 3, 4, 5 and 6. A pages list can contain both comma and dashes, ex: "1, 3, 5-7, 10" meaning that pages 2, 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11 will be extracted.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.MergeFiles(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Merges multiple pdf files into a single pdf file.
member.param: the fully qualified name of the destination file
an array of pdf files that will be merged
member.remarks: This method merges several pdf files into a single one and saves the final pdf file to the location specified by destFileName parameter. The method accepts a string array of pdf files, so multiple pdf files can be appended at once. The files will be merged in the order they appear in the array.
member.exception: thrown when less than 2 source pdf files as given as parameter.
thrown when input pdf files can not be parsed.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.MergeFiles(System.String,System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Merges multiple pdf files into a single pdf file.

an array of pdf files that will be merged
True if the merged PDF file must be saved in fast web view format.
member.remarks: This method merges several pdf files into a single one and saves the final pdf file to the location specified by destFileName parameter. The method accepts a string array of pdf files, so multiple pdf files can be appended at once. The files will be merged in the order they appear in the array.
member.exception: thrown when less than 2 source pdf files as given as parameter.
thrown when input pdf files can not be parsed.

member.remarks: This method merges several pdf files into a single one and returns the new object, so new content and new pages can be added. The method accepts a string array of pdf files, so multiple pdf files can be appended at once. The files will be merged in the order they appear in the array.

thrown when input pdf files can not be parsed.

an array of pdf streams that will be merged
True if the merged PDF file must be saved in fast web view format.

The method accepts an array of pdf streams, so multiple pdf files can be appended at once in memory. The files will be merged in the order they appear in the array.
member.exception: thrown when less than 2 source pdf files are given as parameter.
thrown when input pdf files can not be parsed.

member.name: M:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFFile.MergeFiles(System.IO.Stream[])
member.summary: Merges multiple pdf files into a single object.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFImportedContent
member.summary: Represents the binary content of a page in a pdf file.
member.remarks:
This class represents the binary content of a page in a pdf file. This binary content creates the visual appearance of the page. It contains instructions for drawing text, images, etc. This binary content can be extracted and drawn on a new page. When it is drawn, it can be rotated. The content is automatically scaled to fit the given destination rectangle. To draw only a section of the imported content to the destination rectangle, set the , , and properties to desired values. These values define the clipping rectangle, only the content inside the clipping rectangle will be displayed in the destination rectangle.
Links, form fields and annotations are not part of page content, so when the content is extracted, these items are not included.

member.remarks: The page is rotated clockwise around the bottom left corner when the value of this property is positive.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFFile.PDFImportedPage
member.summary: Represents a page in a pdf file.
member.remarks:
This class represents a single page in a pdf file. A page can be extracted from a pdf document and included anywhere in a new one.
Links, form fields and annotations are part of the page, so when the page is extracted, these items are extracted too.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage
member.summary:
Defines a page within the pdf document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: This class is used to create new pages in a pdf document. The pages can be created in any order. The position of the page in the collection gives the position of the page within the final pdf file. The content of the page is mainly created using the property of the page.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.ID
member.summary: Gets the page id.

member.summary: Gets or sets the tab order index of the last field added on the page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the page transparency group

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.SeparationInfo
member.summary: Gets the separation information associated with the page.
member.value: A object specifying the separation information for the page.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Background
member.summary: Gets or sets the background of the page.
member.value: A object specifying the background of the page.
member.remarks: The background is drawn always first on the page and the rest of page content appears on top of it.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.CustomProperties
member.summary: Gets the collection of custom properties of the page.
member.value: a object storing the page's custom properties.
member.remarks:
The properties in this collection are stored in the page dictionary as custom keys.
If the keys and/or the values in the collection are not strings, an exception is raised when the document is saved.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.RawAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of annotations imported from a PDF/FDF file.

member.summary: Gets the list of annotations included in this page.
member.value: A object storing the annotations in the PDF file that are displayed on this page.
member.remarks: This collection is read-only and it is populated when the object this page belongs to is created based on an external PDF file.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Fields
member.summary: Gets the list of fields included in this page.
member.value: A object storing the fields in the PDF file that are displayed on this page.
member.remarks: This collection is read-only and it is populated when the object this page belongs to is created based on an external PDF file.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.HasDesignFields
member.summary: Gets whether the page has design fields.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.CloseAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript action to execute when the page is closed.
member.value: A object specifying the action to be executed when the page is closed.
member.remarks: A page is closed when the user navigates to the next or previous page or follows a link or an annotation. This action applies to the page being closed and it is executed before any other page is opened.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.OpenAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the javascript action to execute when the page is opened.
member.value: A object specifying the action to be executed when the page is opened.
member.remarks: A page is opened when the user navigates to it from the next or previous page or via a link or an annotation. This action is independent of any action that may be defined by the property and it is executed after such an action.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.LogicalUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical unit for positioning the graphic objects in the page.
member.value: A descendant specifying logical unit used for positioning the graphic objects in the page.
member.remarks: When a page is added to a document, it inherits this value from the document. If you want to set another logical unit for this page, set this property after the page has been added to the document (this applies when the page has been created using an explicit allocation, ex: PDFPage page = new PDFPage( );

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the index within the Pages collection of this Page object

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Number
member.summary:
Gets or sets the page number visual aspect for this object.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: Each page can specify its own appearance for the page number by setting this property to the desired page number object. The default value for this property is the one defined for the whole document.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.ApplyTemplate
member.summary:
Gets of sets the template usage.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A boolean value specifying whether the template should be applied on this page or not.
member.remarks: The template printing on the page can be disabled by setting the property to false.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Template
member.summary:
Gets of sets the template to be printed on the page.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A object specifying the template to be printed on the page.
member.remarks: Common content can be applied to multiple pages using a template. A template specifies content that will be printed under the regular content of the page. The default value of the property is the one defined on the document, but multiple templates can be defined and applied to specific pages.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Transition
member.summary: Gets of sets the presentation effect of the page.

member.value: A object specifying the document the page belongs to.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPage.Owner
member.summary: Sets the owner document of the page.
member.remarks: Done this way because we do not want external users to change the owner, too much side effects.

member.value: A float value specifying the width of the page, in logical units. The default value of this property is inherited from the document.
member.remarks: In a pdf document, each page can have its own width by setting this property to the desired value.

member.summary:
Gets or sets the page height.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A float value specifying the height of the page, in logical units. The default value of this property is inherited from the document.
member.remarks: In a pdf document, each page can have its own height by setting this property to the desired value.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMetadataSchema
member.summary:
Defines a schema within the document's metadata
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: A document's metadata consists of several schemas. A schema groups several properties. Each schema has a name and a namespace prefix.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMetadataSchema.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets schema's name.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A unique string value representing the name of the schema. Usually, this name looks like an URL, but it is a simple identifier. It serves to uniquely identify the schema.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMetadataSchema.NamespacePrefix
member.summary:
Gets or sets schema's namespace prefix.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A string value representing the namespace prefix for this object. It is a short abbreviation for the full schema name. It follows the rules of XML namespaces. This namespace prefix has the local scope of the xmlns attribute that declares it (in the XML representation of the schema).

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMetadataSchema.StoreSchemaInDocInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the properties in this schema are stored also in Document Information dictionary or not.
member.value: If true, the properties in this schema are stored also in Document Information dictionary. Default: false
member.remarks: When schema's properties are stored in the Document Information dictionary, the property name is the key and its value is stored as a string value in the PDF file.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFMetadataSchema.Properties
member.summary: Gets the hashtable storing the properties in this schema.
member.value: A object storing the schema's properties.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline
member.summary:
Defines an outline in the outlines tree hierarchy
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks: An outline is also called a bookmark. The PDF specification calls them outlines, but the Adobe Acrobat uses the term Bookmarks in the user interface. An outline represents a node in the outlines tree displayed in the viewer.

member.summary: Gets or sets the document owning the outline.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.Outlines
member.summary:
Gets the children outlines.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A object representing the collection of the direct descendent outlines.
member.remarks: Each outline holds an outlines collection, that represent the direct children of the outline object.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.Title
member.summary:
Gets or sets the title of the outline.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A string value representing the title of the outline. This title is displayed in the viewer in the outlines tree.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.DestinationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this outline's destination.
member.value: A string value representing the named destination of the outline.
