member.summary:
Gets or sets the color of the outline.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A object specifying the color used to display the outline title in the viewer.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.DestinationPage
member.summary:
Gets or sets the destination page of the outline.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a object representing the destination of the outline. It must be a page within the same document.
member.remarks: If this bookmark has set both DestinationPage and Action properties, then the DestinationPage property will be considered when building the bookmark's destination.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.TopDestination
member.summary:
Gets or sets the vertical position of the destination page.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: a float value specifying the y coordinate of the destination page when it is displayed in the viewer as the result of using the outline.
member.remarks: When the destination page is displayed as the result of using the outline, the y coordinate of the page is positioned at the top of the viewer.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFOutline.Expanded
member.summary:
Gets or sets the initial display of the outline.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A boolean value specifying whether the outline should be displayed expanded or collapsed when the document is initially open in the viewer.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.PDFPageTemplate
member.summary:
Defines a common graphic pattern applied to a series of pages in the document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks:
This class is used to define common content to be printed on one or more pages of the document. The content of the template is created by drawing on its canvas. Also, a page from an external PDF document can be used as source for template content.
When applying a template on a page, its content is placed under the actual content of the page.
Applying a common template to all the pages in the document can be done by setting the property. Individual templates can be applied to a series of pages by setting the property for those pages.

member.name: T:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager
member.summary:
Manages the security settings for a pdf document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.remarks:
A object manages the security associated with a pdf document. It allows to set user and owner passwords, set encryption strength (40 or 128 bit) or set the access rights over the document.
When a object is attached to a object, the resulted pdf file is automatically encrypted.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.EncryptMetadata
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicatig whether document level metadata should be encrypted.
member.value: True if the document metadata is encrypted (default), false otherwise.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets the encryption algorithm used to encrypt the PDF file.
member.remarks: When using AES encrpytion the key size is always 128 bit and the property is set automatically to 128 bit and it can not be changed.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.UserPassword
member.summary:
Gets or sets the user password for the pdf document this security manager object is attached to.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A byte array specifying the user password for the pdf file.
member.remarks: A user password restricts access to a pdf document. When the pdf document is opened, the viewer requests the user to enter a password, if a user password has been set on the document. If the user password has not been set (this property is set to null), then the viewer opens the document without requesting a password. When the pdf document is open with a user password (or without one), the access to the document is restricted by the access rights associated with the document (allow print, etc).

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.OwnerPassword
member.summary:
Gets or sets the owner password for the pdf document this security manager object is attached to.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A byte array specifying the owner password for the pdf file.
member.remarks: An owner password allows the user to get full control over the pdf document. If a pdf file is password protected, entering an owner password when opening the file, allows the user to get full access to the document without any restrictions.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.KeySize
member.summary:
Gets or sets the length of the encryption key.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A enumeration member specifying the length of the encryption key. If the property is , then this property is and it can not be changed.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowPrint
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to print the document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed or not to print the document.
member.remarks: This property, together with and properties, controls the printing of the document. If this property is false, then the user is not allowed to print the document. If this property is true, then the user is allowed to print the document, depending on the value of and properties. If is then property is ignored. If is then if is true, then the document is printed at full quality, otherwise printing of the document is limited to a low-level representation of the document, of degraded quality. This degraded quality printing is viewer implementation dependent.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.FullQualityPrint
member.summary:
Gets or sets the quality of the document printing.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the document is printed in full quality or not.
member.remarks: This property has effect only when property is true and property is set to . If this property is true, then the document is printed at full quality, otherwise printing of the document is limited to a low-level representation of the document, of degraded quality. This degraded quality printing is viewer implementation dependent.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowModifyDocument
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to modify the document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to modify the document or not.
member.remarks: This property, if true, allows a user to modify the content of pdf document by operations other than those controlled by the following properties: , , .

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowInteractiveEdit
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to perform interactive edit operations on the document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to perform interactive edit operations on the document.
member.remarks: This property, if true, allows a user to add or modify text annotations, fill in interactive forms fields, and, if property is true, create or modify interactive form fields (including signature fields).

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowFormsFill
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to fill the form fields in the pdf document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to fill the form fields in the pdf document.
member.remarks: This property has effect only when using 128 bit encryption. ( property is set to ). This property, if true, allows a user to fill in existing interactive form fields (including signature fields), event property is false.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowAssembleDocument
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to assemble the pdf document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to assemble the pdf document or not.
member.remarks: This property has effect only when using 128 bit encryption ( property is set to ). This property, if true, allows a user to assemble the document (insert, rotate, or delete pages and create bookmarks or thumbnail images), event property is false.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowExtractContent
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to extract the content of the document.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to extract the content of the document.
member.remarks: When using 128 bit encryption ( property is set to ), this property, if true, allows a user to copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document by operations other than those controlled by property . When using 40 bit encryption ( property is set to ), then this property also controls extraction of text and graphics in support of accessibility to disabled users or other purposes.

member.name: P:O2S.Components.PDF4NET.Security.PDFSecurityManager.AllowAccessibilityExtractContent
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the user is allowed to extract the content of the document in support of accessibility.
Supported by Compact .NET Edition.
member.value: A bool value specifying whether the user is allowed to extract the content of the document in support of accessibility.
member.remarks: This property has effect only when using 128 bit encryption ( property is set to ). This property, if true, allows a user to copy or otherwise extract text and graphics from the document in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes.
